about.name: Phoenix
about.info_text: Phoenix, the capital of Arizona, is a vibrant city known for its sunny weather, stunning desert landscapes, and a wide range of outdoor and cultural attractions. With a rich Southwestern heritage, Phoenix offers a blend of modern urban living and natural beauty. Visitors can explore the Sonoran Desert, hike in the nearby mountain ranges, and enjoy a thriving arts and culinary scene. Whether you're interested in outdoor adventures or cultural experiences, Phoenix has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.7 million
State: Arizona
Time Zone: Mountain Standard Time (UTC-07:00)
Languages: English, Spanish
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Phoenix has a hot desert climate with extremely hot summers and mild winters. The city is known for its abundant sunshine and low humidity, making it a popular destination for outdoor activities.

attractions_card.title: Desert Botanical Garden
attractions_card.description: The Desert Botanical Garden features a stunning collection of desert plants from around the world, set against the beautiful backdrop of the Sonoran Desert.

attractions_card.title: Camelback Mountain
attractions_card.description: Camelback Mountain offers challenging hiking trails with panoramic views of the Phoenix skyline and the surrounding desert landscape.

attractions_card.title: Heard Museum
attractions_card.description: The Heard Museum is dedicated to Native American art and culture, showcasing an extensive collection of art, jewelry, and historical artifacts.

attractions_card.title: Papago Park
attractions_card.description: Papago Park is a recreational area with hiking trails, gardens, and the famous Hole-in-the-Rock formation, offering great views of the city.

attractions_card.title: Taliesin West
attractions_card.description: Taliesin West is the winter home and architectural school of Frank Lloyd Wright, showcasing his innovative designs and the desert's influence on his work.

attractions_card.title: Chase Field
attractions_card.description: Chase Field is home to the Arizona Diamondbacks and is a popular venue for baseball games and other events in downtown Phoenix.

attractions_card.title: Phoenix Art Museum
attractions_card.description: The Phoenix Art Museum features a diverse collection of art, including American, Asian, European, and Latin American works, as well as contemporary pieces.

attractions_card.title: South Mountain Park
attractions_card.description: South Mountain Park is one of the largest city parks in the United States, offering hiking and biking trails with breathtaking desert views.

food_card.title: Southwestern Cuisine
food_card.description: Phoenix is known for its Southwestern flavors, with dishes like chili, tamales, and Mexican-inspired cuisine that reflect the region's culinary heritage.

food_card.title: Sonoran Hot Dogs
food_card.description: Sonoran hot dogs are a local specialty, featuring bacon-wrapped hot dogs topped with a variety of condiments and flavors.

food_card.title: Mexican Food
food_card.description: You can savor authentic Mexican cuisine in Phoenix, from street tacos and enchiladas to traditional mole dishes.

food_card.title: Farm-to-Table Dining
food_card.description: Phoenix has a growing farm-to-table dining scene, with restaurants sourcing fresh, locally grown ingredients for their menus.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: Food trucks in Phoenix offer a wide range of international and innovative culinary experiences, often found at local events and festivals.

hotels_card.title: The Phoenician
hotels_card.description: The Phoenician is a luxury resort offering top-notch accommodations, golf courses, and spa facilities in a beautiful desert setting.

hotels_card.alt: JW Marriott Phoenix Desert Ridge Resort & Spa
hotels_card.title: JW Marriott Phoenix Desert Ridge Resort & Spa
hotels_card.description: This expansive resort features golf courses, a lazy river, and a spa, making it a perfect destination for relaxation and recreation.

hotels_card.alt: Arizona Biltmore, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
hotels_card.title: Arizona Biltmore, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
hotels_card.description: The Arizona Biltmore is a historic luxury resort known for its elegant architecture, fine dining, and beautiful gardens.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Valley Ho
hotels_card.description: Hotel Valley Ho is a chic and retro-style hotel, offering a unique and comfortable experience in the heart of Scottsdale.

hotels_card.title: Hyatt Regency Phoenix
hotels_card.description: The Hyatt Regency Phoenix is a downtown hotel that provides modern accommodations and is conveniently located near city attractions.

hotels_card.title: Kimpton Hotel Palomar Phoenix
hotels_card.description: This boutique hotel in downtown Phoenix offers stylish rooms and a rooftop pool with great views of the city skyline.

hotels_card.title: The Clarendon Hotel and Spa
hotels_card.description: The Clarendon Hotel and Spa is a trendy and art-focused hotel known for its rooftop bar and pool area.

hotels_card.title: The Camby, Autograph Collection
hotels_card.description: This boutique hotel features unique and stylish design elements, with a focus on providing a memorable stay.

transport_card.title: Valley Metro Light Rail
transport_card.description: The Valley Metro Light Rail system offers convenient public transportation through Phoenix, connecting major points in the city.

transport_card.title: Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport
transport_card.description: Phoenix Sky Harbor is the primary airport serving the region, with domestic and international flights, making it easy to reach Phoenix.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are available at the airport and throughout the city for those who want to explore Phoenix at their own pace.

transport_card.title: Biking
transport_card.description: Phoenix offers biking trails and paths for those who prefer to explore the city on two wheels, with bike rental options available.

transport_card.title: Walking
transport_card.description: Exploring downtown Phoenix on foot is a great way to discover local attractions, restaurants, and cultural sites.
